# Lighthouse CI Results

This directory contains temporary files and results generated by Lighthouse CI during testing.

## Directory Contents

- `lhr-*.json`: Individual Lighthouse report files in JSON format
- `*.html`: Human-readable HTML reports
- `assertion-results.json`: Summary of assertion results
- Temporary files created during test execution

## Files in this directory are automatically generated

Do not manually edit files in this directory as they will be overwritten during the next Lighthouse CI run.

## Cleanup

Files in this directory can be safely deleted. They are automatically regenerated when running Lighthouse tests.

## Viewing Results

To view detailed Lighthouse reports:

1. Start the Lighthouse CI server:
   ```bash
   npm run lighthouse:server
   # or
   npm run test:lighthouse:server
   ```

2. Open your browser to `http://localhost:9009`

3. Navigate through the available reports

## Integration with CI/CD

When running in CI/CD environments, these files are typically:
- Uploaded as artifacts for review
- Compared against baseline performance
- Used for regression detection

## Performance Tracking

For long-term performance tracking, consider:
- Using the Lighthouse CI server with persistent storage
- Integrating with performance monitoring services
- Setting up automated alerts for performance regressions
